perturbation.original_text: Each Party shall cooperate and use its reasonable efforts in making all notifications to, and seeking all consents of, Governmental Authorities necessary or advisable to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby as promptly as practicable. No Party shall take any action that would reasonably be expected to prevent or materially delay or impede the filing or receipt of such necessary or advisable notifications or consents.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party may cooperate and use its good faith efforts in considering making notifications to, and exploring seeking consents of, Governmental Authorities that it subjectively deems necessary or advisable to potentially facilitate the transactions contemplated hereby within a timeframe it finds convenient. No Party shall intentionally take actions that are definitively proven to directly prevent the filing or receipt of notifications or consents.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the obligation by replacing 'shall cooperate and use its reasonable efforts' with 'may cooperate and use its good faith efforts,' making cooperation optional and less rigorous. The subjective qualification of 'subjectively deems' introduces ambiguity, and the relaxed timeline of 'within a timeframe it finds convenient' makes compliance less certain. By saying that Parties will not 'intentionally take actions that are definitively proven to directly prevent the filing or receipt of notifications or consents,' this means the parties can still interfere with the receipt of notifications and consents as long as they claim that they weren't doing it 'intentionally.'
perturbation.contradicted_law: Japanese Corporate Law and regulatory requirements for mergers and acquisitions, which mandate clear and demonstrable efforts to obtain necessary governmental approvals.

perturbation.original_text: SPI shall (i) provide the employees of the Company with employee incentives under such terms and conditions as not less favorable (taking into account, among other things, tax implications) to the incentives made available by the Company to such its employees as of the date of this Agreement […***…], and thereafter under such terms and conditions as not less favorable (taking into account, among other things, tax implications, local laws, and SPI's practices with respect to the employees of Acquiror) to those of the incentives made available by SPI to its employees, and (ii) […***…] the […***…] of the […***… ] of the […***…] as of the […***…] of this [… ***…] at […***…] the […***…] of the […***…] of the […***…] on […***…].
perturbation.changed_text: SPI shall endeavor, to the extent reasonably practicable and subject to internal policy considerations, to consider providing the employees of the Company with employee incentives which may be generally comparable, subject to subjective interpretation, to the incentives hypothetically available to such employees. SPI will also aim to possibly consider the matter of incentives within a timeframe it deems reasonable.
perturbation.explanation: The original obligation is weakened by adding numerous qualifiers that render it unenforceable. 'Endeavor, to the extent reasonably practicable and subject to internal policy considerations' makes providing incentives discretionary. 'May be generally comparable, subject to subjective interpretation' introduces ambiguity about the standards for comparison. The addition of 'hypothetically available to such employees' further muddles the situation by indicating that this does not need to follow the incentives made available to employees of Acquiror
perturbation.contradicted_law: Japanese Labor Law, which requires clear and non-discriminatory employment terms and conditions following a merger or acquisition.

perturbation.original_text: The Indemnifying Party's liability for all claims made under this Agreement shall be subject to the following limitations: (i) the Indemnifying Party shall […***…] for such claims until the […***…] of the […***…] shall […***…] of the […***…] by the […***…] of all of the […***…] and […***…] of […***…], in which case the Indemnifying Party shall be liable only for the […***…] of the [… ***…] of the […***…] by the […***…] of all of the […***…] and […***…] of […***…], and (ii) the Indemnifying Party's […***…] for [… ***…] shall not […***…] of the […***…] by the […***…] of all of the […***…] and […***…] of […***…].
perturbation.changed_text: The Indemnifying Party's liability for claims made under this Agreement will be potentially subject to limitations which may or may not be invoked at the Indemnifying Party's sole discretion, taking into account its then-current financial situation, market conditions, and other subjective factors it deems relevant. The extent of any such limitation shall be determined on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: This change makes the limitation of liability entirely discretionary by using 'will be potentially subject to limitations' and 'which may or may not be invoked at the Indemnifying Party's sole discretion.' The vague criteria ('then-current financial situation, market conditions, and other subjective factors it deems relevant') and the individual assessment ('shall be determined on a case-by-case basis') introduce significant ambiguity, making it difficult to enforce any indemnification obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Japanese Contract Law regarding the enforceability of indemnification clauses, which requires reasonable and clearly defined limitations.
